tit.e: Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko (Kyoto Sericulture School)
tit.cmt: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%97%A7%E5%88%B6%E9%AB%98%E7%AD%89%E5%AD%A6%E6%A0%A1より、旧制「高等学校」は現在の「高校」ではなく、高等学校令に基づく高等教育機関であり、現在では大学1.2年に相当するとのことなのですが、「高等」という言葉が必要かと判断し、「Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko (Kyoto Sericulture High School)」と訳しました。
tit.e: Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko (Kyoto Sericulture High School)
Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko
tit.cmt: (Kyoto Sericulture High School)次のセルに説明がありますので、削除しました。

sen.j: 京都高等蚕業学校 （きょうとこうとうさんぎょうがっこう） は、1914年 （大正3年） に設立された旧制専門学校。
sen.e: Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School) founded in 1914 was a vocational school under the old-education system.
sen.cmt: 京都高等蚕業学校’を'Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School)としました。
sen.e: Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko (Kyoto Sericulture High School) founded in 1914 was a vocational school under the old-education system.
Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko (Kyoto Sericulture High School) founded in 1914 was a vocational school under the old-education system.

sen.j: 1931年 （昭和6年） に京都高等蚕糸学校、1944年に京都繊維専門学校と改称された。
sen.e: In 1931, it was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School), and again, in 1944, it was renamed 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).
sen.cmt: 京都高等蚕糸学校’を 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School)、’京都繊維専門学校’を'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School)としました。
sen.e: In 1931, it was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School), and again, in 1944, it was renamed 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).
In 1931, it was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School), and again, in 1944, it was renamed 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).

sen.j: 本項は、改称後の 2校および前身の京都蚕業講習所を含めて記述する。
sen.e: This section describes the renamed two schools and its predecessor, ' Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture).
sen.cmt: 京都蚕業講習所’を' Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture)としました
sen.e: This section describes the two renamed schools and its predecessor, ' Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture).
This section describes the two renamed schools and its predecessor, Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo (kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture).

tit.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 1899年 （明治32年） 設立の農商務省 (日本)京都蚕業講習所を前身とする。
sen.e: The predecessor is ' (Nihon) Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' ((Japanese) Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) founded in 1899 under the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.
Its predecessor was '(Nihon) Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' ((Japanese) Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) founded in 1899 under the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.
Its predecessor was (Nihon) Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo ((Japanese) Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) founded in 1899 under the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.

sen.j: 大正時代初期に農商務省から文部省に移管され、京都高等蚕業学校となった （広義の高等農林学校）。
sen.e: It was transferred from the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce to the Ministry of Education in the early Taisho period and became 'Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School). (It was 'Agriculture and Forestry High School' in a broad category.)

It was transferred from the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce to the Ministry of Education in the early Taisho period and became 'Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School). (It was in the broad category of 'Agriculture and Forestry High School')

It was transferred from the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce to the Ministry of Education in the early Taisho period and became 'Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School). (It was in the broad category of 'Agriculture and Forestry High School')

sen.j: 1931年、製糸科増設により京都高等蚕糸学校と改称された。
sen.e: In 1931, it was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School) because 'the Silk Reeling course' was added.
sen.cmt: 高等学校時代の'科’は基本的に’本科’(the regular course)と’別科’(the special course)に分かれているようなので、courseを使い、'製糸科'は、the Silk Reeling courseと訳しました
sen.e: In 1931, it was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School) because 'the Silk Reeling course' was added.
In 1931, it was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School) because 'the Silk Reeling course' was added.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦中に京都繊維専門学校 （京都繊専） と改称された。
sen.e: During World War Ⅱ, it was renamed 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' abbreviated as 'Kyoto Sen-sen' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).
During World War Ⅱ, it was renamed 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' abbreviated as 'Kyoto Sen-sen' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).
During World War Ⅱ, it was renamed 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' abbreviated as 'Kyoto Sen-sen' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).

sen.j: 学制改革で新制京都工芸繊維大学繊維学部 （現・工芸科学部） の母体となった。
sen.e: In the reform of the education system, it became the original body of the faculty of Textile Science (present-day, the school of Science and Technology) in 'Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku' (Kyoto Institute of Technology) established under the new education system.
sen.cmt: 学部名については、京都工繊のHP、http://www.kit.ac.jp/english/01/01_040000.html を参考にしました
sen.e: In the reform of the education system, it became the original body of the faculty of Textile Science (present-day, the school of Science and Technology) in 'Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku' (Kyoto Institute of Technology) established under the new education system.

In the reform of the education system, it became the original body of the faculty of Textile Science (present-day, the school of Science and Technology) in Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku (Kyoto Institute of Technology) established under the new education system.

sen.j: 同窓会は 「衣笠同窓会」 （きぬがさどうそうかい） と称する。
sen.e: The alumni association of the school is named 'Kinugasa Doso-kai (Kinugasa Association).
sen.cmt: <一原文一訳の例外＞ と称し、旧制・新制 →と称する。これは、旧制・新制
sen.e: The alumni association of the school is named 'Kinugasa Doso-kai' (Kinugasa Association).
The alumni association of the school is named 'Kinugasa Doso-kai' (Kinugasa Association).

sen.j: これは、旧制・新制 （旧繊維学部） 合同の会となっている （2006年、繊維学部・工芸学部が工芸科学部に統合されたため、同窓会も京都工芸繊維大学同窓会に統合の方向）。
sen.e: It is a joint alumni association of the old system and the new system (the former faculty of Textile Science). ('Kinugasa Association' is going to be merged with 'the alumni association of Kyoto Institute of Technology', since the faculty of Engineering and Design and the faculty of Textile and Science were integrated into the school of Science and Technology in 2006.)
sen.cmt: <一原文一訳の例外＞ と称し、旧制・新制 →と称する。これは、旧制・新制
sen.e: It is a joint alumni association of the old system and the new system (the former faculty of Textile Science) ('Kinugasa Association' is going to be merged with 'the alumni association of Kyoto Institute of Technology,' since the faculty of Engineering and Design and the faculty of Textile and Science were integrated into the school of Science and Technology in 2006).

It is a joint alumni association of the old system and the new system (the former faculty of Textile Science) ('Kinugasa Association' is going to be merged with 'the alumni association of Kyoto Institute of Technology,' since the faculty of Engineering and Design and the faculty of Textile and Science were integrated into the school of Science and Technology in 2006).

tit.e: History
History
History
The days of 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture).
The days of 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture)
The days of 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture)

sen.j: 1899年3月30日： 官立蚕業講習所官制改正により蚕業講習所増設 （勅令第89号）。
sen.e: On March 30, 1899: the number of training institute of sericulture increased due to the revision of the system for national training institute of sericulture (the edict No. 89).
On March 30, 1899: The number of training institutes for sericulture increased due to a revision of the system for national training institutes of sericulture (edict No. 89).
On March 30, 1899: The number of training institutes for sericulture increased due to a revision of the system for national training institutes of sericulture (edict No. 89).

sen.j: 1899年6月： 京都蚕業講習所設置公示 （農商務省告示第61号）。
sen.e: In June, 1899: the establishment of 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) was publicly announced. (an announcement of the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce, No. 61).
In June, 1899: The establishment of 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) was publicly announced (an announcement by the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce, No. 61).
In June 1899: The establishment of 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) was publicly announced (an announcement by the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce, No. 61).

sen.j: 本科 （修業年限2年）・別科 （同5ヶ月）。
sen.e: The regular course (the term was two years) ・ the special course (the term was five months)
The regular course (two-year term) ・ The special course (five-month term)
The regular course (two-year term)/The special course (five-month term)

sen.j: 1901年： 技師 石渡繁胤 （のち所長）、カイコ卒倒病菌発見。
sen.e: In 1901: Shigetane ISHIWATA, an engineer (later, the head of the institute) discovered 'Kaiko Sotto-byo-kin (a Gram-positive, soil-dwelling bacterium) from silkworms.
sen.cmt: カイコ卒倒菌の英訳が見当たらなかったので、ここでは、http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacillus_thuringiensis を参考に'Kaiko Sotto-byo-kin (a Gram-positive, soil-dwelling bacterium) from silkworms.’とました。
sen.e: In 1901: Shigetane ISHIWATA, an engineer (later, the head of the institute) discovered 'Kaiko Sotto-byo-kin' (a Gram-positive, soil-dwelling bacterium) from silkworms.
In 1901: Shigetane ISHIWATA, an engineer (later, the head of the institute) discovered Kaiko Sotto-byo-kin (a Gram-positive, soil-dwelling bacterium) from silkworms.

sen.j: 1915年、エルンスト・ベルリナー (Ernst Berliner) によってバチルス・チューリンゲンシスと正式命名。
sen.e: In 1915, 'Kaiko Sotto-byo-kin' was formally named 'Bacillus thuringiensis' by Ernest Berliner.
In 1915, 'Kaiko Sotto-byo-kin' was formally named 'Bacillus thuringiensis' by Ernest Berliner.
In 1915, 'Kaiko Sotto-byo-kin' was formally named 'Bacillus thuringiensis' by Ernest Berliner.

sen.j: 1902年： 養蚕講習科設置 （本科2年・別科6ヶ月に変更）。
sen.e: In 1902: 'the training course of Sericulture' was created. (the course term was changed: the regular course term was two years ・ the special course term was six months)
sen.cmt: 養蚕講習科’を'the training course of Sericulture' としました
sen.e: In 1902: 'The training course for Sericulture' was created. (the course term was changed: the regular course term was two years ・ the special course term was six months)
In 1902: The training course for Sericulture was created. (the course term was changed: the regular course term was two years/the special course term was six months)

sen.j: 製糸講習科も設置されたが、実際には開講されず。
sen.e: The training course of Silk Reeling' was created, but actually was not opened.
sen.cmt: 製糸講習科’を'the training course of Silk Reeling'としました
sen.e: The training course for Silk Reeling was created, but was not actually opened.
The training course for Silk Reeling was created, but was not actually opened.

sen.j: 1905年： 本科3年制に変更。
sen.e: In 1905: the regular course term changed into three years.
In 1905: The regular course term changed to three years.
In 1905: The regular course term changed to three years.

sen.j: 入学資格： 満17歳以上・旧制中学校卒業程度 （旧制専門学校と同じ）。
sen.e: The requirements for admission: at age 17 or over ・ having intelligence equivalent to graduates from junior high school under the old-education system (whose level was the same as vocational school under the old-education system).

The requirements for admission: 17 years of age or over ・ graduated from junior high school under the old-education system (whose level was the same as a vocational school under the old-education system).

The requirements for admission: 17 years of age or over, graduated from junior high school under the old-education system (whose level was the same as a vocational school under the old-education system).

sen.j: 1906年： 校友会誌 『衣笠蚕友会報』 創刊。
sen.e: In 1906: the journal of the graduate association, " Kinugasa Sanyu kai-ho" (the journal of Kinugasa Sericulture Association) was first issued.
In 1906: The journal of the graduate association, "Kinugasa Sanyu kai-ho" (the journal of Kinugasa Sericulture Association) was first issued.
In 1906: The journal of the graduate association, "Kinugasa Sanyu kai-ho" (the journal of Kinugasa Sericulture Association) was first issued.

sen.j: 1921年：『衣笠蚕報』 と改題。
sen.e: In 1921: 'Kinugasa Sanyu kai-ho' was renamed 'Kinugasa San-po' (the journal of Kinugasa Sericulture).
sen.cmt: 原文の「,」を「:」にして前行・後行と同様式に揃えました 1921年、→1921:
sen.e: In 1921: 'Kinugasa Sanyu kai-ho' was renamed 'Kinugasa San-po' (the journal of Kinugasa Sericulture).
In 1921: "Kinugasa Sanyu kai-ho" was renamed "Kinugasa San-po" (the journal of Kinugasa Sericulture).
In 1940: the journal was discontinued.
In 1940: The journal was discontinued.
In 1940: The journal was discontinued.

sen.j: 1908年： 女子部を設置 （2年制）。
sen.e: In 1908: 'the women's course' was established (the course term was two years).
In 1908: 'The women's course' was established (the course term was two years).
In 1908: The women's course was established (the course term was two years).

sen.j: 1913年6月13日： 農商務省から文部省に移管。
sen.e: On June 13, 1913: 'Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture' was transferred from the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce to the Ministry of Education.
On June 13, 1913: 'Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture' was transferred from the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce to the Ministry of Education.
On June 13, 1913: Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture was transferred from the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce to the Ministry of Education.

tit.j: 京都高等蚕業学校時代

sen.j: 1914年4月1日： 京都高等蚕業学校と改称 （3月31日勅令第44号で文部省直轄諸学校官制改正）。
sen.e: On April 1, 1914: 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School). (due to the revision of the system for schools under the direct control of the Ministry of Education by the edict No. 44 issued on March 31)

On April 1, 1914: 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School) (due to a revision of the system for schools under the direct control of the Ministry of Education by the edict No. 44 issued on March 31).

On April 1, 1914: Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture) was renamed Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko (Kyoto Sericulture High School) (due to a revision of the system for schools under the direct control of the Ministry of Education by the edict No. 44 issued on March 31).

sen.j: 本科 （修業年限3年）・別科 （同6ヶ月）。

sen.j: 1914年7月： 第1回卒業。
sen.e: In July 1914: it held the first graduation ceremony.

sen.j: 京都蚕業講習所時代の入学者。

sen.j: 1915年4月： 女子部廃止。
sen.e: In April 1915, 'the women's course' was closed down.
In April 1915, 'the women's course' was closed down.
In April 1915: The women's course was closed down.

sen.j: 1920年： 本科に蚕種科を増設。
sen.e: In 1920: 'Sanshu-ka' (the silkworm eggs course) was added to the regular course.
sen.cmt: 蚕種科’を'Sanshu-ka' (the silkworm eggs course)としました
sen.e: In 1920: 'Sanshu-ka' (the silkworm eggs course) was added to the regular course.
In 1920: Sanshu-ka (the silkworm eggs course) was added to the regular course.

sen.j: 従来の本科を養蚕科と改称。
sen.e: The existing regular course was renamed 'Yosan-ka' (the sericulture course).
sen.cmt: 養蚕科’を'Yosan-ka' (the sericulture course)としました
sen.e: The existing regular course was renamed 'Yosan-ka' (the sericulture course).

sen.j: 別科1年制に延長。
sen.e: The term of the special course was extended to one year.
The term of the special course was extended to one year.
The term of the special course was extended to one year.

sen.j: この年の春から、BM祭 （家蚕 学名 Bombyx mori の慰霊祭） を挙行。
sen.e: Since the spring of this year, 'BM festival' (the memorial service for silkworms, known as Bombyx mori as a scientific name) has been held.
Since the spring of this year, 'BM festival' (a memorial service for silkworms, known by the scientific name of Bombyx mori) has been held.

sen.j: 1921年3月： 校歌制定。
sen.e: In March 1921: the school song was established.
In March 1921: The school song was established.
In March 1921: The school song was established.

sen.j: 『黄塵跡をとどめざる』 （作詞者不詳、弘田龍太郎 作曲）
sen.e: The title of the school song is "Kojin ato todomezaru" (Once sandstorms blow up to the sky by strong winds, they left no traces of their existence on the ground.). (The songwriter was unknown and the composer was Ryutaro HIROTA.)
sen.cmt: 校歌『黄塵跡をとどめざる』の英語訳を"Kojin ato todomezaru" (Once sandstorms blow up to the sky by strong winds, they left no traces of their existence on the ground.) としました
sen.e: The title of the school song is "Kojin ato todomezaru" (Once sandstorms are blown into the sky by strong winds, they leave no traces of their existence on the ground) (The songwriter was unknown and the composer was Ryutaro HIROTA).

The title of the school song is "Kojin ato todomezaru" (Once sandstorms are blown into the sky by strong winds, they leave no traces of their existence on the ground) (The songwriter was unknown and the composer was Ryutaro HIROTA).

sen.j: 作詞者は櫛淵真澄説も。
sen.e: It was also said that the songwriter might be Masumi SHITSUBUCHI.
It was also said that the songwriter might be Masumi SHITSUBUCHI.
It was also said that the songwriter might be Masumi SHITSUBUCHI.

sen.j: 1923年4月： 嵯峨桑園を葛野郡嵯峨村（現・右京区嵯峨一本木町）に設置。
sen.e: In April 1923: 'Saga so-en' (Saga mulberry field) was created in Saga-village, Kadono-Province (present-day, Saga ippongi-cho, Ukyo Ward).
sen.cmt: 原文一部語順変更 「嵯峨桑園を設置 （葛野郡嵯峨村、現・右京区嵯峨一本木町）。→嵯峨桑園を葛野郡嵯峨村（現・右京区嵯峨一本木町）に設置。」

In April 1923: Saga so-en (Saga mulberry field) was created in Saga-village, Kadono-Province (present-day, Saga ippongi-cho, Ukyo Ward).

sen.j: 1924年： 別科を養蚕実科と改称。
sen.e: In 1924: 'the special course' was renamed 'Yosan-jitsuka' (the practical sericulture course).
sen.cmt: 養蚕実科’を 'Yosan-jitsuka' (the practical sericulture course)としました
sen.e: In 1924: 'The special course' was renamed 'Yosan-jitsuka' (the practical sericulture course).

sen.j: 1931年2月： 本科に製糸科を増設。
sen.e: In February 1931: 'Seishi-ka' (the silk reeling course) was added to the regular course.

tit.j: 京都高等蚕糸学校時代
tit.e: The days of 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School)

sen.j: 1931年3月： 京都高等蚕糸学校と改称。
sen.e: In March 1931: 'Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School) was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School).
In March 1931: 'Kyoto Koto Sangyo Gakko' (Kyoto Sericulture High School) was renamed 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School).

sen.j: 本科学科： 養蚕科・蚕種科・製糸科。
sen.e: The regular course: 'Yosan-ka' (the sericulture course), 'Sanshu-ka' (the silkworm eggs course), Seishi-ka' (the silk reeling course).
The regular course: 'Yosan-ka' (the sericulture course), 'Sanshu-ka' (the silkworm eggs course), Seishi-ka' (the silk reeling course).
The regular course: Yosan-ka (the sericulture course), Sanshu-ka (the silkworm eggs course), Seishi-ka (the silk reeling course).

sen.j: 1934年9月： 室戸台風で生物実験室半壊。
sen.e: In September 1934: the Muroto Typhoon partially destroyed the biological experiment laboratory.
In September 1934: The Muroto Typhoon partially destroyed the biological experiment laboratory.
In September 1934: The Muroto Typhoon partially destroyed the biological experiment laboratory.

sen.j: 1937年6月： 製糸教婦科を設置 （修業年限2年）。
sen.e: In June 1937: the silk reeling for women was created. (The term was two years.)
In June 1937: The silk reeling course for women was created. (The term was two years.)
In June 1937: The silk reeling course for women was created. (The term was two years.)

sen.j: 1942年4月： 本科に繊維化学科を増設。
sen.e: In April 1942: 'Seni Kagaku-ka' (the textile and chemistry course) was added to the regular course.
sen.cmt: 繊維化学科’を 'Seni Kagaku-ka' (the textile and chemistry course)としました
sen.e: In April 1942: 'Seni Kagaku-ka' (the textile and chemistry course) was added to the regular course.
In April 1942: Seni Kagaku-ka (the textile and chemistry course) was added to the regular course.

tit.j: 京都繊維専門学校時代
tit.e: The days of 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School)
The days of 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School)
The days of Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko (Kyoto Textile Vocational School)

sen.j: 1944年4月1日： 京都繊維専門学校と改称。
sen.e: On April 1, 1944: 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School) was renamed 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).
On April 1, 1944: 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School) was renamed 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).
On April 1, 1944: Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko (Kyoto Silk High School) was renamed Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko (Kyoto Textile Vocational School).

sen.j: 本科学科： 蚕糸科 （養蚕専攻・製糸専攻）・繊維化学科・繊維農業科 （新設）・紡織科 （福井高等工業学校から移管）。
sen.e: The faculties for the regular course: 'the faculty of Silk' (specializing in sericulture ・ specializing in silk reeling) ・ 'the faculty of Textile and Chemistry ・the faculty of Textile and Agriculture (newly established) ・ the faculty of Spinning and Weaving (transferred from 'Fukui Technical High School').
sen.cmt: 「京都繊維専門学校」に改称されてから「本科」ではなく「本科学科」が使われているので、「the faculty of」をつけています
sen.e: The faculties for the regular course: 'The faculty of Silk' (specializing in sericulture ・ specializing in silk reeling) ・ 'the faculty of Textile and Chemistry ・the faculty of Textile and Agriculture (newly established) ・ the faculty of Spinning and Weaving (transferred from 'Fukui Technical High School').

The faculties for the regular course: The faculty of Silk (specializing in sericulture/specializing in silk reeling)/the faculty of Textile and Chemistry/the faculty of Textile and Agriculture (newly established)/the faculty of Spinning and Weaving (transferred from Fukui Technical High School).

sen.j: 嵯峨桑園を嵯峨農場と改称。
sen.e: Saga so-en' (Saga mulberry field) was renamed 'Saga no-jo' (Saga farm).
Saga so-en (Saga mulberry field) was renamed 'Saga no-jo' (Saga farm).
Saga so-en (Saga mulberry field) was renamed Saga no-jo (Saga farm).

sen.j: 1945年： 製糸教婦科、1年制に短縮。
sen.e: In 1945: the term of the faculty of Silk Reeling for Women was shortened into one year.
In 1945: The term of the faculty of Silk Reeling for Women was shortened into one year.
In 1945: The term of the faculty of Silk Reeling for Women was shortened into one year.

sen.j: 1946年4月： 蚕糸科を分科、養蚕科・製糸科を設置。
sen.e: In April 1946: The faculty of Silk was divided into the faculty of Sericulture and the faculty of Silk Reeling.
In April 1946: The faculty of Silk was divided into the faculty of Sericulture and the faculty of Silk Reeling.
In April 1946: The faculty of Silk was divided into the faculty of Sericulture and the faculty of Silk Reeling.

sen.j: 1947年： 紡績実習工場完成。
sen.e: In 1947: the spinning training factory was established.
In 1947: The spinning training factory was established.
In 1947: The spinning training factory was established.

sen.j: 1948年3月： 製糸教婦科、廃止。
sen.e: In March 1948: the faculty of Silk Reeling for Women was closed down.
In March 1948: The faculty of Silk Reeling for Women was closed down.
In March 1948: The faculty of Silk Reeling for Women was closed down.

sen.j: 1948年7月： 京都高等工芸学校と合同で 「京都工芸繊維大学」 設置認可申請。
sen.e: In July 1948: an application for approval of establishing "Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku" (Kyoto Institute of Technology) was submitted in conjunction with 'Kyoto Koto Kogei Gakko' (Kyoto Polytechnic High School).
sen.cmt: 京都高等工芸学校’を 'Kyoto Koto Kogei Gakko' (Kyoto Polytechnic High School)としました
sen.e: In July 1948: An application for approval of establishing "Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku" (Kyoto Institute of Technology) was submitted in conjunction with 'Kyoto Koto Kogei Gakko' (Kyoto Polytechnic High School).

In July 1948: An application for approval of establishing "Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku" (Kyoto Institute of Technology) was submitted in conjunction with Kyoto Koto Kogei Gakko (Kyoto Polytechnic High School).

sen.j: 1949年5月31日： 新制京都工芸繊維大学発足。
sen.e: On May 31, 1949: 'Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku' (Kyoto Institute of Technology) was established under the new education system.
On May 31, 1949: 'Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku' (Kyoto Institute of Technology) was established under the new education system.
On May 31, 1949: Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku (Kyoto Institute of Technology) was established under the new education system.

sen.j: 旧制京都繊維専門学校は、繊維学部 （養蚕学科・製糸紡績学科・繊維化学科） の母体として包括された。
sen.e: Kyoto Textile Vocational School' under the old system was included as the original body of the faculty of Textile and Science (the faculty of Sericulture ・ the faculty of Silk Spinning ・ the faculty of Textile and Chemistry).

Kyoto Textile Vocational School under the old system was included as the original body of the faculty of Textile and Science (the faculty of Sericulture ・ the faculty of Silk Spinning ・ the faculty of Textile and Chemistry).

Kyoto Textile Vocational School under the old system was included as the original body of the faculty of Textile and Science (the faculty of Sericulture/the faculty of Silk Spinning/the faculty of Textile and Chemistry).

sen.j: 大学本部は、旧生糸検査所 （上京区一条御前通東入） に設置。
sen.e: The headquarters of 'Kyoto Institute of Technology' was located in Higashi-iru, Ichijo onmae-Dori, Kamigyo Ward, where 'the former inspection center of raw silk' was placed.
sen.cmt: ＜一原文一訳の例外＞ 大学本部は工芸学部 （旧京都工専、左京区松ヶ崎） と繊維学部の中間地点、旧生糸検査所 （上京区一条御前通東入） に設置。→大学本部は、旧生糸検査所 （上京区一条御前通東入） に設置。これは、工芸学部 （旧京都工専、左京区松ヶ崎） と繊維学部の中間地点に位置する。
sen.e: The headquarters of 'Kyoto Institute of Technology' were located in Higashi-iru, Ichijo onmae-Dori, Kamigyo Ward, where 'the former inspection center of raw silk' was placed.
The headquarters of Kyoto Institute of Technology were located in Higashi-iru, Ichijo onmae-Dori, Kamigyo Ward, where the former inspection center of raw silk was placed.

sen.j: これは、工芸学部 （旧京都工専、左京区松ヶ崎） と繊維学部の中間地点に位置する
sen.e: It was in the middle of the faculty of Engineering and Design (the predecessor was 'Kyoto Technical Vocational School' located in Matsugasaki, Sakyo Ward) and the faculty of Textile and Science.
sen.cmt: ＜一原文一訳の例外＞ 大学本部は工芸学部 （旧京都工専、左京区松ヶ崎） と繊維学部の中間地点、旧生糸検査所 （上京区一条御前通東入） に設置。→大学本部は、旧生糸検査所 （上京区一条御前通東入） に設置。これは、工芸学部 （旧京都工専、左京区松ヶ崎） と繊維学部の中間地点に位置する。
sen.e: It was in the middle of the faculty of Engineering and Design (whose predecessor was 'Kyoto Technical Vocational School' located in Matsugasaki, Sakyo Ward) and the faculty of Textile and Science.
It was in the middle of the faculty of Engineering and Design (whose predecessor was Kyoto Technical Vocational School located in Matsugasaki, Sakyo Ward) and the faculty of Textile and Science.

sen.j: 1951年3月： 京都繊維専門学校、廃止。
sen.e: In March 1951: 'Kyoto Textile Vocational School' was abolished.
In March 1951: 'Kyoto Textile Vocational School' was abolished.
In March 1951: Kyoto Textile Vocational School was abolished.

tit.e: Campus
Campus
Campus

sen.j: 前身の京都蚕業講習所から引き継いだ、葛野郡衣笠村大字大将軍 （現・京都市北区大将軍坂田町） から花園村 （現・京都市右京区花園鷹司町） にかけての校地を使用した。
sen.e: The campus was placed in the area stretching from 'Oaza Taishogun, Kinugasa-Village, Kadono-Province' (present-day, Sakata-cho, Taishogun, Kita Ward, Kyoto City), which was taken over form the predecessor, 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture), to 'Hanazono-Village' (present-day, Takatsukasa-cho, Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City).

The campus was placed in the area stretching from 'Oaza Taishogun, Kinugasa-Village, and Kadono-Province' (present-day, Sakata-cho, Taishogun, Kita Ward, Kyoto City), which it took over from its predecessor, 'Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo' (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture), to 'Hanazono-Village' (present-day, Takatsukasa-cho, Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City).

The campus was placed in the area stretching from Oaza Taishogun, Kinugasa-Village, and Kadono County (present-day, Sakata-cho, Taishogun, Kita Ward, Kyoto City), which it took over from its predecessor, Kyoto Sangyo Koshu-jo (Kyoto Training Institute of Sericulture), to Hanazono-Village (present-day, Takatsukasa-cho, Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 衣笠校地は後身の京都高等蚕糸学校・京都繊維専門学校・京都工芸繊維大学繊維学部に引き継がれた。
sen.e: The Kinugasa campus' was taken over to 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School), to 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School) and to the faculty of Textile and Science in 'Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku' (Kyoto Institute of Technology).
sen.cmt: ＜一原文一訳文の例外＞ 引き継がれ、1968年7月に→引き継がれた。そしてこれは1968年7月に
sen.e: The Kinugasa campus was inherited from the 'Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko' (Kyoto Silk High School), 'Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko' (Kyoto Textile Vocational School) and the faculty of Textile and Science in 'Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku' (Kyoto Institute of Technology).

The Kinugasa campus was inherited from the Kyoto Koto Sanshi Gakko (Kyoto Silk High School), Kyoto Seni Senmon Gakko (Kyoto Textile Vocational School) and the faculty of Textile and Science in Kyoto Kogei Seni Daigaku (Kyoto Institute of Technology).

sen.j: そしてこれは、1968年7月に京都市左京区松ヶ崎 （工芸学部 旧京都工業専門学校 校地） に統合移転するまで使用された。
sen.e: This campus had been used until July 1968, when it was integrated and relocated to Matsugasaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City (where the campus of the faculty of Engineering and Design (the predecessor was 'Kyoto Technical Vocational School') was placed).
sen.cmt: ＜一原文一訳文の例外＞ 引き継がれ、1968年7月に→引き継がれた。そしてこれは1968年7月に
sen.e: This campus had been used until July 1968, when it was integrated and relocated to Matsugasaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City (where the campus of the faculty of Engineering and Design (its predecessor was 'Kyoto Technical Vocational School') was placed).

This campus had been used until July 1968, when it was integrated and relocated to Matsugasaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City (where the campus of the faculty of Engineering and Design (its predecessor was Kyoto Technical Vocational School) was placed).

sen.j: 現在、旧衣笠校地は花園団地となっている。
sen.e: Today, the site of the Kinugasa Campus is used for 'Hanazono housing estates'.
Today, the site of the Kinugasa Campus is used for 'Hanazono housing estates.'
Today, the site of the Kinugasa Campus is used for Hanazono housing estates.
